page.title: 17Pubs Around Stetchworth
page.content: The Stetchworth pub is The Marquis of Granby, a Greene King house. It has one bar and serves bar snacks and meals at weekends. It also has a garden. It is known in the village as the "top pub". This expression dates from the time when people had to distinquish it from the other two village pubs which are now closed. One is now a private house with stables and the other is a guest house. Stetchworth also has a Royal British Legion club. In Woodditton, the pub is the Three Blackbirds. It is a Tolly Cobbold house, and has a restaurant with a good reputation locally. Saxon Street's pub is The Reindeer. It too is a Tolly Cobbold house. It serves bar snacks and has two bars. It has recently reopened after having been closed down for a while.
